snippet: Carl Levin of the Armed Services Committee said financial constraints and the changing nature of security threats were arguments against a large inventory of warheads.
abstract: Sen Carl Levin, Democrat of Michigan and chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, calls on the Obama administration to seek cuts in nuclear warheads far beyond the requirements of current treaties; says that there is no reason for having such a large inventory given the diminished nuclear threat and tighter military budgets.
lead_paragraph: Carl Levin of the Armed Services Committee said financial constraints and the changing nature of security threats were arguments against a large inventory of warheads.

headline.seo: Senator Urges Bigger Cuts to Nuclear Arsenal
headline.main: Senator Urges Bigger Cuts to Nuclear Arsenal
headline.print_headline: Senator Urges Bigger Cuts to Nuclear Arsenal
